etymology.description: 斤(斤) (jīn, "a short axe") + 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") = a pair of hands holding a weapon -> soldier or military
etymology.interpretation: The character 兵(bīng) represents the concept of a soldier through the depiction of two hands grasping an axe, symbolizing the act of holding a weapon. This effectively conveys the idea of military force or the presence of soldiers.

examples.chinese: 他是一名勇敢的兵(他是一名勇敢的兵)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yī míng yǒnggǎn de bīng.

examples.chinese: 当战鼓响起时(當戰鼓響起時)，所有的兵都聚集在前线(所有的兵都聚集在前線)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng zhàngǔ xiǎngqǐ shí, suǒyǒu de bīng dōu jùjí zài qiánxiàn.
examples.english: When the war drums sounded, all the soldiers gathered at the front line.
